quiz.question: What does "bark up the wrong tree" suggest?

Which idiom exemplifies euphemism used to soften mention of death?

Which idiom is an example of a mixed metaphor combining nautical and hunting imagery?
What does "hit the nail on the head" mean?
Which idiom suggests "making a delicate situation worse by careless talk"?
Which idiom is often used as a performative speech act to wish luck?
What does "a blessing in disguise" describe?
Which idiom matches "experience that teaches a tough lesson"?
Which idiom is considered a dead metaphor because original imagery is no longer visual?
What does "go the extra mile" encourage someone to do?
Which idiom expresses "someone who avoids commitment or responsibility"?
Which idiom best qualifies as an idiomatic collocation where words combine unpredictably?
